title: Understanding the Problem
text: You are given two reactions with their respective enthalpy changes, ΔH. Your task is to calculate the enthalpy change for a different, yet related, reaction. To do this, you'll need to consider how these reactions combine to form the new reaction.

title: Identify Common Elements
text: Notice that the reaction we need to find the enthalpy for is C₂H₂+2H₂→C₂H₆. Check how C₂H₂ and C₂H₆ appear in the given reactions and identify any common species.

title: Constructing the Overall Reaction
text:
The target reaction is C₂H₂+2H₂→C₂H₆. You can achieve this by adding the two given reactions:

$$1$$. C₂H₂+H₂→C₂H₄ with $$\Delta H_1=-175.0kJ$$
$$2$$. C₂H₄+H₂→C₂H₆ with $$\Delta H_2=-136.0kJ$$

Adding these will give you the overall reaction you need.

title: Combine Reaction Enthalpies
text: To find the enthalpy change of the overall reaction, sum the enthalpy changes of the individual reactions. Calculate ΔH=ΔH₁+ΔH₂.
